content.raw: Any tips on best way to test this branch? I tried to backport TPE to blueprint to test this, but encountered compiling issues due to feature conflicts. Should I just use bullet in this case? Or I can forward port this into a citadel branch like what you did with #541. I think Im gonna try that
content.html: Any tips on best way to test this branch? I tried to backport TPE to blueprint to test this, but encountered compiling issues due to feature conflicts. Should I just use bullet in this case? Or I can forward port this into a citadel branch like what you did with #541. I think Im gonna try that

content.raw:
Thanks for checking. You can try with Bullet to see that the missing features list decreases. Another thing to check is that all features being made optional still work with DART. 

Checking with TPE would be good, but it will just print a different list of missing features. So maybe it's not worth the effort right now.

I think the main thing to check in this PR is whether the general approach is ok. I'll open new PRs to make all the features missing from TPE optional.

I think the main thing to check in this PR is whether the general approach is ok. I'll open new PRs to make all the features missing from TPE optional.

content.raw: Sounds good. I’ll check those. Thanks!

Confirm behaviour as expected. Different/shorter list of missing features are warned when testing with TPE/Bullet/HelloWorld plugins.

Terminal output see below

`Bullet`: `find_physics_engined` 

```
$ IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build/ignition-physics ign gazebo -v 2 shapes.sdf --physics-engine ignition-physics-bullet-plugin
[Wrn] [Physics.cc:378] Plugin [ignition::physics::bullet::Plugin] misses required features:
- N8ignition7physics14FixedJointCastE

[GUI] [Wrn] [Application.cc:649] [QT] file::/ComponentInspector/ComponentInspector.qml:161: ReferenceError: ComponentsModel is not defined
[GUI] [Wrn] [RenderUtil.cc:903] Failed to create grid for scene [scene] on engine [ogre2]
```

`Bullet`: `chapulina/bullet`, with significantly fewer missing features printed

```
$ IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build/ignition-physics ign gazebo -v 2 shapes.sdf --physics-engine ignition-physics-bullet-plugin

[GUI] [Wrn] [Application.cc:649] [QT] file::/ComponentInspector/ComponentInspector.qml:161: ReferenceError: ComponentsModel is not defined
```

```
[GUI] [Wrn] [Application.cc:649] [QT] file::/ComponentInspector/ComponentInspector.qml:161: ReferenceError: ComponentsModel is not defined
```

content.raw: This looks great! I like how casts are cached so that they don't hurt performance. I wanted to point out that it's not just the `MinimumFeatureList` that should not be modified. Even the `DetachableJointFeatureList` is now part of the ABI because adding a feature to it would break physics engine plugins that once worked. So if we really needed to add a feature to `DetachableJointFeatureList`, I guess we'll have to have another list, maybe `DetachableJointFeatureListWithNewFeature` and have some logic that tries to cast to `DetachableJointFeatureListWithNewFeature` first then fallback to `DetachableJointFeatureList`. I really hope it doesn't come to that though :fingers_crossed:
content.html: This looks great! I like how casts are cached so that they don't hurt performance. I wanted to point out that it's not just the MinimumFeatureList that should not be modified. Even the DetachableJointFeatureList is now part of the ABI because adding a feature to it would break physics engine plugins that once worked. So if we really needed to add a feature to DetachableJointFeatureList, I guess we'll have to have another list, maybe DetachableJointFeatureListWithNewFeature and have some logic that tries to cast to DetachableJointFeatureListWithNewFeature first then fallback to DetachableJointFeatureList. I really hope it doesn't come to that though
